availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Russell Knight Thornberry (Webster Co., KY, farmer)

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Emeline Poole Thornberry. Father of Mary E. Thornberry, Ann E. Thornberry, Matilda Nancy Thornberry, George W. Thornberry, Samuel Thornberry, Elizabeth Thornberry, William Thornberry, Marion Thornberry, Andrew J. Thornberry, and Susan R. Thornberry. Farmer in Henderson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860. Assessed taxes for slaughtering hogs in Webster County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky,
Henderson County, District 2, p. 329B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 522-23.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866, NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 2.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #26156.
"Russell Knight Thornberry (1809-1900)," Find A Grave, Memorial #86691957, accessed August 23, 2017, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/86691957.
